title: 820-00239-A no display
message:
it’s a water damage
The screen connector is burnt in the screen clip side. So I decided to chang the screen connector flex and the screen.  , still  no display.
I check the voltages on j8500
Pp3v3_s0 is not present
I2c_bklt_sis is 5v is present on pin 24 and 26
Smbus_smc_0_s0_sda is 3v3 is present on pin 28 and 30
I2ca_als_sda/scl 3v3 is present on pin 34 and 36
I2c_cam_scl/sda 1.7 is present on pin 38 and 40.
PP5v_so-alscam_f is present
Pp5v_s0sw_lcd is not present
Pls help me out.
No enable signal on both u8500 and 8501

title: 820-00239-A no display
message:
Very likely CPU's eDP output was burnt.
Do you get external video at least?

Post diode mode to ground on all EDP_INT data lines (J8500).

title: 820-00239-A no display
message:
Ok. Edp_panel_pwr_en not present on u8501 357
aux_n 365
aux_p 350
ml_n356
ml_n<1> 337
ml_p<1> 338
ml_n<2> 357
ml_p_<2>374
ml_n_<3>339
ml_p_<3>347
mipi_data_conn_n 1342
Mipi_data_conn_p 1305
Mipi_clk_conn_n 1269
Mipi_clk_conn_p 1267
Am suspecting U8510 not creating enable signals
Pp3v3_g3h is present
Pm_slp_s3_l is present 
Smc_reset_l is present 
Edp_panel_pwr_en is missing

title: 820-00239-A no display
message:
"Do you get external video at least?"

Check diode mode to ground at 3V3/5V_S0SW_LCD, w/ and w/o LCD connected.

title: 820-00239-A no display
message:
How can we get correct replies from you?
Should I write 3-4 times in the same post, to avoid more posts???
"Do you get external video at least?"

Did you even check for USB activity???

title: 820-00239-A no display
message: No external video to external display, but cpu is getting warm.

title: 820-00239-A no display
message:
Disconnect internal LCD and check again external video.
Also let us know if you get USB activity.
PLEASE, do all test we recommend.
There is no reason to expect video, if no USB activity is detected.
